alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; City of Emporia; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Prince George; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 7:30PM EST until January 09 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN NORTHAMPTON...GREENSVILLE...WEST CENTRAL SOUTHAMPTON...SOUTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...WESTERN SUSSEX... SOUTHEASTERN DINWIDDIE AND SOUTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF EMPORIA... At 730 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Barley, or 7 miles west of Roanoke Rapids, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Barley around 735 PM EST. Emporia and Radium around 745 PM EST. Jarratt around 750 PM EST. Sussex and Stony Creek around 805 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Adams Grove, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Bufford Crossroads, Lanes Corner, Booker, Yale, Pleasant Shade, Henrico, and Bryants Corner. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for northeastern North Carolina...and south central and southeastern Virginia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
